intro: Mibora desvauxii, commonly known as the golden bell tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that resemble bells. The plant is deciduous, shedding its leaves during the dry season, and can grow up to 10 meters in height. Its bark is smooth and grayish, while its leaves are opposite and compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. Mibora desvauxii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in landscaping due to its vibrant floral display.
